exercises.name: Plank
instructions: Start in a push-up position with forearms on the ground
Keep elbows directly beneath shoulders
Engage core and maintain a straight line from head to heels
Hold position for the target duration
cues: Don't let hips sag or pike up

exercises.name: Side Plank
instructions: Lie on your side with forearm on the ground, elbow under shoulder
Stack feet or stagger them for stability
Lift hips to create a straight line from head to feet
Hold position, then repeat on the other side

exercises.name: Up-Down Plank
instructions: Start in a forearm plank position
Push up to a high plank one arm at a time
Lower back down to forearm plank one arm at a time
Alternate the leading arm each rep

exercises.name: Plank Jacks
instructions: Start in a high plank position with feet together
Jump feet out wide, then back together
Maintain a stable core and flat back throughout
Continue for the target duration or reps
cues: Keep hips level, don't let them bounce
Land softly on the balls of your feet

exercises.name: Crunch
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on floor
Place hands behind head or across chest
Curl shoulders off the ground by contracting abs
Lower back down with control
cues: Focus on curling the ribcage toward pelvis

exercises.name: Bicycle Crunch
instructions: Lie on your back with hands behind head, legs raised
Bring right elbow toward left knee while extending right leg
Alternate sides in a pedaling motion
Keep lower back pressed into the floor
cues: Rotate through the torso, not just the elbows
Keep extended leg elevated, not touching the ground

exercises.name: Reverse Crunch
instructions: Lie on your back with legs raised, knees bent at 90 degrees
Place arms at sides for stability
Curl hips off the floor, bringing knees toward chest
Lower back down with control
cues: Lift with your abs, not momentum
Keep upper back on the floor

exercises.name: Cable Crunch
instructions: Kneel facing away from a high cable with rope attachment
Hold rope at the sides of your head
Curl torso down, bringing elbows toward knees
Return to starting position with control
cues: Focus on spinal flexion, not hip flexion
Control the weight on the way up

exercises.name: Lying Leg Raise
instructions: Lie on your back with legs extended, arms at sides
Press lower back into the floor
Raise legs toward the ceiling, keeping them straight
Lower legs with control, stopping before they touch the floor
cues: Keep lower back pressed into the floor
If too difficult, bend knees slightly
Control the descent to increase tension

exercises.name: Hanging Leg Raise
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with arms fully extended
Engage core and raise legs until parallel to the floor (or higher)
Keep legs straight throughout the movement
Lower with control back to starting position
cues: For advanced, raise toes to the bar

exercises.name: Captain's Chair Leg Raise
instructions: Position yourself in the captain's chair with back against pad
Support yourself on the arm rests, legs hanging
Raise knees toward chest (or legs straight for more difficulty)
Lower with control
cues: Focus on curling pelvis up, not just lifting legs

exercises.name: Sit-Up
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat or anchored
Place hands behind head or across chest
Sit all the way up by contracting your abs
Lower back down with control
cues: Engage core from the start of the movement

exercises.name: V-Up
instructions: Lie flat on your back with arms extended overhead
Simultaneously raise legs and torso, reaching hands toward toes
Form a V shape at the top of the movement
Lower back down with control
cues: Balance on your tailbone at the top

exercises.name: Dead Bug
instructions: Lie on your back with arms extended toward ceiling
Raise legs with knees bent at 90 degrees
Slowly lower opposite arm and leg toward the floor
Return to start and repeat on the other side
cues: Keep lower back pressed into the floor throughout

exercises.name: Hollow Body Hold
instructions: Lie on your back with arms extended overhead
Press lower back into the floor
Raise legs and shoulders slightly off the ground
Hold this position, forming a banana shape
cues: Keep lower back glued to the floor
Point toes and reach through fingertips
If too hard, bend knees or raise limbs higher

exercises.name: Ab Wheel Rollout
instructions: Kneel on a mat with ab wheel in front of you
Grip the handles and engage your core
Roll the wheel forward, extending your body
Pull back to starting position using your abs
cues: Keep core tight throughout, don't let hips sag
Go only as far as you can control
Squeeze abs hard on the way back

exercises.name: Standing Ab Wheel Rollout
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, ab wheel on the ground
Bend at the hips and grip the handles
Roll the wheel forward, keeping legs straight
Roll back to starting position
cues: Start with partial range of motion

exercises.name: Mountain Climber
instructions: Start in a high plank position
Drive one knee toward your chest
Quickly switch legs, bringing the other knee forward
Continue alternating at your target pace
cues: Keep hips level, don't let them bounce up

exercises.name: Russian Twist
instructions: Sit with knees bent, feet flat or elevated
Lean back slightly and lift feet off the ground
Rotate torso side to side, touching the floor beside you
Keep core engaged throughout
cues: Rotate through the torso, not just arms
For added difficulty, hold a weight

exercises.name: Medicine Ball Russian Twist
instructions: Sit with knees bent, holding a medicine ball at chest
Lean back and lift feet off the ground
Rotate torso side to side, moving the ball across your body
Touch the ball to the floor on each side
cues: Control the weight, don't let momentum take over
Keep feet elevated for more challenge

exercises.name: Cable Woodchop
instructions: Stand sideways to a cable machine with handle at high position
Grip handle with both hands, arms extended
Pull diagonally across body from high to low
Control the return, then repeat. Switch sides.
cues: Rotate through hips and torso together

exercises.name: Medicine Ball Woodchop
instructions: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width, holding medicine ball
Start with ball at one hip
Rotate and lift ball diagonally across body overhead
Return with control and repeat. Switch sides.
cues: Drive the movement from your hips and core

exercises.name: Dumbbell Side Bend
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbell in one hand
Keep other hand behind head or at side
Bend sideways toward the weighted side
Contract obliques to return to upright. Switch sides.
cues: Move in the lateral plane only, no forward/backward lean

exercises.name: Windshield Wiper
instructions: Lie on your back with arms out to sides for stability
Raise legs straight up toward the ceiling
Keeping shoulders down, lower legs to one side
Return to center and lower to the other side
cues: Keep both shoulders on the ground

exercises.name: Hanging Windshield Wiper
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with straight arms
Raise legs up so body forms an L-shape (or higher)
Rotate legs side to side like a windshield wiper
Control the movement throughout
cues: Requires significant grip and core strength
Keep upper body as stable as possible
Start with smaller range of motion

exercises.name: Superman
instructions: Lie face down with arms extended overhead
Simultaneously lift arms, chest, and legs off the ground
Hold briefly at the top
Lower back down with control
cues: Squeeze glutes and back muscles at the top
Keep neck neutral, look at the floor

exercises.name: Bird Dog
instructions: Start on hands and knees in a tabletop position
Extend opposite arm and leg simultaneously
Hold briefly, maintaining a flat back
Return to start and repeat with the other side

exercises.name: Back Extension
instructions: Position yourself face down on a roman chair
Secure ankles under pads, hips on the pad
Cross arms over chest or behind head
Lower torso down, then extend back up to neutral

exercises.name: Stability Ball Crunch
instructions: Lie back on a stability ball with feet flat on the floor
Position ball under lower back
Place hands behind head or across chest
Crunch up, then lower back over the ball
cues: Use the ball's curve for a greater range of motion
Keep feet firmly planted for stability

exercises.name: Stability Ball Rollout
instructions: Kneel behind a stability ball, forearms resting on top
Roll the ball forward by extending arms
Keep core engaged and back flat
Pull back to starting position using your abs
cues: Don't let hips sag or pike up
Start with smaller range of motion

exercises.name: Decline Sit-Up
instructions: Secure ankles under pads on a decline bench
Lie back with hands behind head or across chest
Sit all the way up against gravity
Lower back down with control
cues: Don't use momentum to swing up

exercises.name: Pallof Press
instructions: Stand sideways to a cable machine at chest height
Hold handle at chest with both hands
Press arms straight out in front of you
Hold, resisting the rotation, then return to chest
cues: Don't let the cable rotate your torso

exercises.name: Band Pallof Press
instructions: Anchor a resistance band at chest height
Stand sideways to the anchor, holding band at chest
Press arms straight out, resisting rotation
Hold, then return to chest. Repeat, then switch sides.
cues: Keep your body square to the front
Resist the pull of the band
